result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin James Drahonovsky

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:08 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Dustin James Drahonovsky in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Dustin James Drahonovsky.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Jensen provides an update; he has received an offer and has discussed it with his client.  Atty. Jensen believes the matter is on a resolution path but wants one more further proceedings to negotiate with the State.  Court recommends setting the matter for plea and sentencing in middle of December.  Atty. Jensen has no objection.  State has no objection.  Court adjourns for projected plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:14 AM; Case called for Hearing. Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dustin James Drahonovsky in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Dustin James Drahonovsky.   Atty. Jensen provides an update, he is requesting time to negotiate further with the State.  Atty. Jensen requests a further proceedings date in October.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

10:17 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Dustin James Drahonovsky in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that 22CF973 just had the preliminary hearing before the Court Commissioner and inquires how the matters will be proceeding.  Atty. Jensen requests an arraignment date in 22CF973, and this can tag along with for status.  Court adjourns for hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:07 PM Defendant Dustin James Drahonovsky in court with attorney Amanda Nimmer for attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.
The Court quashes the warrant.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:02 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen in court.   Defendant Dustin James Drahonovsky did not appear.   Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Jensen advises he has attempted to contact his client with no success, and has no idea why he has not appeared today.  State requests the court issue a capias and order bail be revoked and/or forfeited.  Court will issue a capias and orders bail be forfeited.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons to include knives and/or brass knuckles, except when working for his employer on a construction job and going to and from work.

10:09 AM Defendant Dustin James Drahonovsky in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
